fields.description:
h3.Summary

When a field is set as 'required' and attempting to create a child ticket in Portfolio, Portfolio throws an error when attempting to commit the changes (issue creation). The screen that allows the user to fill in the required field appears but the error on 'required field' is still thrown. Said child ticket is also created despite the error but is no longer under parent but is created as a stand-alone ticket.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Set any field as required (eg. Description or Component).
# Attempt to create a child ticket.  
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Commit changes and field in required field.  
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Error is returned.  
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# Ticket is created as stand alone ticket.  
!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Expected Result

An error should not be returned regarding required fields since you can fill it up before the commit. 

h3.Current Result

Error is returned despite filling the required field. The issue is also created as a stand-alone ticket instead of a child ticket.

h3.Workaround

Remove restriction from the field.
fields.summary: Portfolio throws an error when attempting to create a ticket with any required field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1716]. {panel} h3. Summary JPO is timing out when creating a plan and importing only a few issues from a huge list of possible issues to be imported. h3. Environment Portfolio for JIRA v2.1.5-OD-002-D20161109T020439 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a board # Add 2000 tickets to this board # Try to create a plan from that board selecting a single issue (or only a couple of them) h3. Expected Results JPO would import only the selected issues. h3. Actual Results JPO is timing out. After a couple of minutes the following error message will show up: {code}Bummer, something has gone terribly wrong here... Please try refreshing the page. If the issue continues, please copy and paste the information in the Details button below and send to your JIRA Administrator or Atlassian Support.{code} {noformat}Unexpected error result. Atlassian Cloud Notifications - Page Unavailable

Loading notifications...
  • Atlassian Cloud Status
  • Release Summary
  • Documentation
  • Answers
Atlassian
=============== === Request === =============== URL: /rest/jpo/1.0/plans Type: POST Status: 504 =================== === Client Info === =================== User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/54.0.2840.71 Safari/537.36 Local time: Tue Nov 01 2016 14:41:53 GMT-0400 (Eastern Daylight Time) =================== === Plugin Info === =================== Plugin build: 2.1.2-OD-004-D20161018T080005 SEN: Unknown =================== === System Info === =================== JIRA Title: JIRA JIRA Version: 1000.482.3 Agile Version: 1000.135.0 {noformat} h3. Notes When having more than 1000 issues to be possibly added into the scope, if not selecting them while creating the plan, JPO will have to manually (one-by-one) set a property that the issue are excluded from the plan, which is possibly causing the timeout. h3.Workaround # Create plan with all issues and exclude the ones we don't want later: A workaround would be to create the plan with all issues initially and then exclude them from the plan in batches by directly selecting them in the Scope view and committing these changes. # Create filter with the tickets that should be part of plan and use that as Portfolio data source *Downside: losing data association to boards*. Another option is to create a filter in JIRA that only returns the issues you need and to select this as your plans data source. The problem here is that you'll likely lose the main ability of live plans, which is to update the issues in their sources.
fields.summary: JPO times out when creating a plan excluding large amounts of issues (~1,000+)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1632].
  {panel}

Portfolio introduced a custom field to show the parent relations directly on JIRA issues.
When editing this field a search is performed to help the user find the appropriate parent issue.
The search implementation has a bug resulting in an excessive memory consumption, which impacts performance severely and may even result in memory errors which require a restart of the JIRA instance.

To avoid this situation, please remove the Parent Link custom field from all of your issue screens.
fields.summary: Usage of Parent Link custom field search results in excessive memory consumption

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1495].
  {panel}

When creating a plan based off of a board with an active sprint, issues are included in plan even though they are not selected on the Scope page when configuring issue source.
* These issues are "Done" status and do not appear on the Scope page at all.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create JIRA Software Scrum Software Development project, add sprint
# Create issue and add to sprint, start sprint and then change issue status to "Done"
# Create plan using scrum board as source (use default selections on releases, teams, and scope pages)
#* On the "Confirm what's in scope" page, note no issues appear and "0 selected"
# Expand "Issues without parent Epic" and note that the "Done" issue was included in plan.

h5. Expected Behavior
Creating a plan with "0 selected" on the Scope page should create a plan that contains no issues. 
* These "Done" issues should either not be included in the new plan or they should show up on the Scope page so that they can be selected or un-selected

h5. Workaround
After you create the plan you can exclude the "Done" issues. You can do this by checking the issue box and clicking "Exclude from plan".
fields.summary: Done issues in active sprint not showing in issue source but are still added to plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a plan contains an issue source based on a filter or board (with filter) using the Portfolio's Parent Link custom field, scheduling doesn't work correctly - in most cases no calculation data will be available.
h3. Reproduce

Create an epic and a story and set choose the epic in the story's Parent link field
Create a filter or change a board's filter query to "parent link = EPIC-KEY
Create a plan based on this filter
Set some values in the respective estimate column, depending on your plan configuration (storypoints vs time based)
Click the calculate button
h3. Expected Result

Visible calculation result in the scheduling panel
h3. Actual Result

No scheduling result available
h3. Workaround

Try to construct your filter without using the Parent Link custom field.
fields.summary: Scheduling broken when using Portfolio's Parent Link field in the issue source

fields.description:
h3. Description
In the team view the sum of capacities of the resources in a team is wrong if resources have a default availability different than 40h.
The schedule calculation is unaffected by this error.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Reproduce
1) Change Jira's time tracking settings to have 6h of work per day.
2) Create a plan using hours as scheduling unit
3) Create a Kanban team and add a resource to with default capacity value

h3. Summary
It is not possible to bulk edit a parent link for multiple Epics at the same time. The dropdown to select the parent link is missing.
 !parentlink.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go the Issue Navigator and perform a bulk edit with 2 or more Epics
# Selecting the Parent Link, there is no dropdown
# Confirming, the Parent Link will take the value for the first issue

h3. Expected Results
A dropdown should be shown, where you can select another parent link. 

h3. Actual Results
Dropdown missing, so cannot choose another parent link and Jira will take the value for the first Epic to apply to others.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1584].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Adding estimates to an issue creates multiple new estimates. This will result is abnormally high number for estimate.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new issue.
# Assign it to an epic on a portfolio plan.
# Don't provide any time estimates.
# Navigate to the portfolio plan.
# Expand the epic, locate the new issue.
# In the "estimates (h)" column, add a new estimate: 1w.
# Commit the changes.
# Browse to the issue in core JIRA (i.e., /browse/KEY-123)
# Click on the "All" tab in the "Issue Activity" section.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.9, JIRA Portfolio 2.0.4

h3. Expected Results

* The original estimate and remaining estimate for the issue should be set once each.

h3. Actual Results

* The original estimate field is set to 1w in the first change item.
* The original estimate and remaining estimate fields are both set to 1w in a second change item.
* The remaining estimate field is set to 1d in a third change item. 

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Adding estimates to an issue creates multiple new estimates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues are missing on timeline when they have multiple releases

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud + Portfolio

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create releases *One*, *Two* and *Three* (this sequence should be followed during the creation.
#* The ids will be similar to 10001, 10002, 10003.
# Create an issue and add to the release *One* 
# Add the same issue to the release *Two* 
# Recalculate the plan
# Filter the plan by release *One*
#* The issue will be listed on scope and it will be displayed on timeline
# Remove *One* from the filter and select *Two*
#* The issue will be listed on scope and it will be missing on timeline

h3. Expected Results
Issues are listed when filtering both versions.

h3. Actual Results
Issues are only listed when filtering the release with lower id. 
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Issues are missing on timeline when they have multiple releases

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Accessing JIRA Issue as anonymous user will spam logs with warnings

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure Portfolio is installed in the instance
# Make a project accessIble by anonymous by adding the *Anyone* group to the *Browse Project* permission in the permission scheme for any project.
# Note down the issue key of any issue in the project Eg: SSP-1
# Log out of JIRA
# Access the noted issue directly through the URL. Eg: {{/browse/SSP-1}}
# Check the logs

h3. Expected Results
THe user can access the issue and nothing should appear in the logs

h3. Actual Results
Everytime the anonmous user accesses the issue, then the logs get spammed with the following warning:
{code}
WARN anonymous 1239x891x1 1k22vfz 10.60.9.69 /browse/SSP-1 [c.a.r.j.p.w.children.condition.ChildIssuesPanelVisibilityCondition] Exception when evaluating if child issues panel should be displayed.
{code}
 
h3. Notes
This could be a major issue is there are several users accessing issues anonymously, thereby the logs get flooded with the warnings.
fields.summary: Accessing JIRA Issue as anonymous user will spam logs with warnings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1042].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
According to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Status+and+Progress+Tracking], in the backlog:
{quote}
Completed items show a full green line.
{quote}

This is illustrated below as number 4:
!Progress bars.png|thumbnail!

Also, the issue should count toward the Epic progress as part of the finished progress bar (increasing the bar).

However, this is not happening, at least not in JIRA Portfolio Cloud. When completing the issue and updating the plan, the issue is completely removed from the plan and it stops reflecting in the progress.

h3. Environment
This was reproduced in JIRA Cloud, version: 7.1.0-OD-01-048
The Portfolio version is 1.10.7-OD-001-D20151111T050557 (not available in the 'Affects Version/s field)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create plan with 'Sample data set'
# Create a 'Scrum Software Development' project (a Software project)
# Create and link all issues in one initiative, as instructed below:
#* Hover cursor over the initiative (initiatives page)
#* Click the down arrow that appers
#* Click 'Create and link new issues'
#* Keep all of them selected and select the project created before in 'Create in project'
#* Click 'Create an link issues'
# Log work in a story issue
# Update plan
#* Plan >> Update from date >> enter today >> 'Initiallize'
#* Progress in its Epic will increase
# Move same story issue to 'Done'
# Update plan again

h3. Expected Results
* After moving issue to 'Done', issue continues in the plan
* It's progress is full
* It continues to count toward progress of the Epic

h3. Actual Results
* Story issue is completely removed from board
* The Epic progress won't count (in this case, as this was the only issue with progress, the Epic progress will go down to empty again)
 

h3.Workaround
None so far
fields.summary: Complete story issues are removed from board and stop counting towards progress

h3. Summary
In the schedule/timeline view in Portfolio 2.0, hovering over a field with the cursor does no longer display labels. Previously, a label was shown so you could see the full title of the field, but this is no longer working for some browsers. 

h3. Environment
* Portfolio for JIRA - 2.0.1-OD-004-D20160606T234856
* Chrome
* Firefox
* Tried Safari initially and worked correctly, now it doesn't seem to work either.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to your instance an open a Portfolio plan
# In the top right corner, click *Report* and then in the dropdown *Switch report* in the left side select *Schedule*
# Set the cursor over a field, a label should appear displaying the whole name, but it doesn't.

h3. Expected Results
After hovering with the cursor over any field a label would show up and display the whole title of such field.

h3. Actual Results
No label is shown, and as a result the whole title can not be seen.

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Hovering in Portfolio 2.0 stopped working

fields.description:
h3.Summary

It is no longer possible to scroll the scope section with the mouse wheel while holding a ticket. Running a test on the Server version (version 2.17.1), this behavior is possible on Server but not on Cloud anymore.

This unintentional change is quite disruptive as it's quite difficult to prioritize issues now with the scroller broken. This is especially true when there are a large amount of tickets in the scope section.
fields.summary: The Portfolio plan scope section can no longer be scrolled when holding a ticket

fields.description:
h3. Summary  
Currently, Portfolio allows custom fields in read-only mode to be added at Source Data > Custom fields, but this will trigger an a bummer error with the following stack trace. 
{code}
{"error":"unexpected-error","errorMessages":[],"exception":{"type":"org.postgresql.util.PSQLException","message":"ERROR: current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block","stackTrace":[{"className":"org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl","methodName":"receiveErrorResponse","line":2477}
{code}

At the development panel, it indicates that it is related to custom fields in the plan:
{code}
Request header field x-atlassian-mau-ignore is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Headers in preflight response.
{code}

This error indicates the problem related to read-only custom fields at the plan.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a portfolio plan
# Add the issue source
# Go to more *(...)* > Configure, under Source Data option select *Custom Fields*
# Add any read-only custom field
# Reload the plan and the error will prompt.


h3. Expected Results  
Portfolio would not even show custom fields that are read-only.

h3. Actual Results 
Portfolio displays custom fields that are read-only, allowing to select and it will cause the bad state.

h3.Workaround 
No workaround
To fix the issue, remove the custom fields from Source Data > Custom Fields.
fields.summary: Portfolio allows custom fields read-only mode and puts the database in a dead state

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Velocity chart's commitment points are not consistent with the values observed in Sprint report or the corresponding burndown chart for the sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Cannot reproduce it consistently, but please refer to the screenshots.
 ## *Test Sprint 4* started off with *13* story points initially.
 ## BurndownScreenshot:
   !BurndownSprint4.png|thumbnail!
 ## However, Velocity chart records an initial commitment of 8 points.
 ## VelocityChart: 
 !VelocityChart.png|thumbnail!
 ## BurndownChartDetails:
   !BurndownDetailsSprint4.png|thumbnail!
 # Similar to this, again, for sprint *Test Sprint 10*
 ## Started off with commitment story points of *9*, as seen in the Burndown chart.
 ## burndownSprint10:
   !BurndownSprint10.png|thumbnail!
 ## This time, velocity chart shows the correct commitments though.
 ## VelocityChart: 
 !VelocityChart.png|thumbnail!
 ## BurndownChartDetails: 
 !BurndownDetailsSprint10.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

An expected value for the Commitment story points should have been,

Commitment= SUM of Story Points (Issues Completed during the sprint + Issues Not Completed during the sprint + Issues Removed from the Sprint after it started)

That is, it should have considered the story points for ALL the issues which were present at the *beginning* of the sprint.
h3. Actual Results

The values in the Velocity Chart are not correctly recorded, as corroborated by above screenshots. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Velocity chart's commitment shows incorrect value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I create a connection to a Github repository as a non-admin user, I get a modal "Integrate Jira with GitHub" with a button "Ask my admin", which doesn't seem to notify the admin.

Also, the text of the modal is not really understandable:

"Your repo is now linked, but your team can get visibility of development progress in their issues when GitHub and Jira are integrated."

Should probably be:

"Your repo is now linked, but your team can *only* get visibility of development progress in their issues when GitHub and Jira are integrated."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click "Add item" in the left-hand navigation menu as a non-admin in a next-gen project.
 # Click "Add" a repository.
 # Paste a Github repo URL into the "Repository link" field.
 # In the next modal, click on "Ask my admin"

h3. Expected Results

The admin gets an email to take action on installing the GitHub repository.
h3. Actual Results

The admin doesn't get an email.

The button sends a request with the following payload to the endpoint `https://events-test.jira-dev.com/rest/projects/1.0/project/EV/shortcut/8`:
{noformat}
{  
   "url":"https://github.com/thombergs/code-examples",
   "name":"code-examples",
   "icon":"",
   "type":"source.code.link",
   "dvcsType":"github",
   "isPendingApproval":true,
   "dvcsOrg":"thombergs",
   "dvcsRepo":"code-examples",
   "newGithubDvcsIntegrationsAllowed":true,
   "githubAppInstalled":false,
   "id":"4"
}{noformat}
So the button does something, but the server isn't sending the email.
h3. Workaround

Tell the admin manually to install the Github integration.
fields.summary: When connecting a Github Repo, the Button "Ask my admin" doesn't send an email to the Admin

fields.description:
Please can you make an amendment to the Rules function inside New Gen.

Inside the Update an issue field, there is a dropdown list, please can you include the flag option into this list? We use the flags as a way of highlighting tickets which are on hold / blocked.

If you include the flag option, when a ticket is transitioned from lane to lane we could then automatically add this flag & change the colour of the ticket.
fields.summary: Add a "Flag" automatically through the manage rules function

fields.description:
In the backlog the issue key shows in two places, on the card and on the detail view to the right. 

Both issue keys are highlighted as hyperlinks ({color:#0747a6}+blue and underlined+{color})

Clicking on the hyperlink on the card (left hand side) opens the detail view on the backlog for that issue. The detail view is also opened by clicking anywhere on the card.

I suggest that both hyperlinks should carry out the same behaviour; they should both open the full issue view navigating away from the backlog. 

My reasoning:
 * The hyperlinks both are visually the same yet exhibit different behaviour which confuses the user. Some users click multiple times on the left hand link expecting it to open the full issue view.
 * To open the full issue view you have to carry out 3 steps: click on issue card in the backlog, move mouse to the other side of the screen, click on the other hyperlink presented. This would be better as a single step to open the issue.
 * The user can still open the detail panel by clicking anywhere on the card other than the issue key hyperlink

!image-2020-06-09-08-47-36-341.png!
fields.summary: Issue key on backlog view should navigate to the full issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the [Get sprint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-agile-1-0-sprint-sprintId-get] endpoint to get Sprint data via REST API does not include the "true start date".

That is to the date the Sprint was actually started and not the value provided in the *Start date* which can be any date.

h3. Proposed solution

An additional field needs to be added in the API to include the true start date:

{code}
{
"id": 34,
"self": "https://featureflagjunkie.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/34",
"state": "active",
"name": "New Sprint JSON 11",
"startDate": "2020-06-05T13:50:16.751Z",
"trueStartDate": "2020-06-08T13:50:16.751Z",
"endDate": "2022-09-09T14:33:00.000Z",
"originBoardId": 3,
"goal": ""
}
{code}
fields.summary: Get sprint endpoint missing true start date

fields.description:
I would like to have the assigned Bitbucket pull request code reviewers available for the new smart values for automation rules.

My use case: I have a custom field for "Reviewers" on Jira issues, which is a multi-user select.

I would like, when a pull request is created, to populate this custom field automatically with the reviewers assigned in bitbucket, and then be able to search and filter issues based on that.

I see, according to this page, that pull request title and url are already supported. [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-development/]

(The reason I need a custom field is because Jira only supports a single assignee and I don't want to change the assignee, I want to keep a history of who worked on this issue).
fields.summary: Add bitbucket pull request reviewers as option for "smart values"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since the implementation of the GDPR and with the deprecation of usernames some features haven't been fully adapted.  This is the case of the Advanced Search Page, where the accountId is now the preferred value when you search for a user. 
 Show the username/email in a tooltip or enhance this behaviour for users having *Browse User and groups* Global permission when you enter or select a user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Advanced Search page
 # Add some users as a search criterion and switch to Advanced Search JQL.
 # It translates into accoutIDs
 # On this JQL, it is not possible to know who is the user on each accountId.

h3. Expected Results

If the GDPR forbids to save the filter with email or usernames, implement a tooltip or mechanism to identify the users. 
 It is needed because old values in comments, issue history are marked with the Username, making very difficult to identify users. Gadgets, filters require usernames but there is no direct way to get them.
h3. Actual Results

Only AccountIDs are shown in JQL advanced search without a clue to know who is the user.
h3. Workaround

Create a temporary filter and test every single user accountId. 
 Being site-admin to access user page section (x)
fields.summary: Improve JQL search page for user identification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not currently possible to create child issues from within the issue view for issue types that are created and configured as additional levels of hierarchy. The default Epic, Story, Task, and Sub-task issue types support this but custom issue types in the hierarchy do not.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow child issue creation from the issue view for custom issue types in the current hierarchy.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create the child issues manually and then link them to the desired parent via setting the Parent Link field or by dragging the issues underneath the desired parent in the plan view and then saving the changes to Jira.
fields.summary: Show Create Child Issue Option in Issue View for Custom Issue Types in the Hierarchy

fields.description: When I import my issues and fill in the FixVersion field, versions are created.  But, there is no place to specify Status, Start Date or Released Date for the version.  There should be a way to import versions with these attributes either by importing versions alone, or by specifying them in the issues import by allowing you to map fields for version status, version start date and version release date.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you have a component in the query from a filter in a board, if you create an issue through the quick creation inline in the backlog the expected behavior is that the component in the query is auto-populated in the component field from the issue, there is a BUG that when you created an issue in a board and then go to another board an create a new issue this takes the component from the previous board instead of the current one, this causes the issue to not be visible in the board where it is being created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 2 boards, in 1 configure a component in the filter and a different one in the other board
 # Create an issue in the backlog in the quick creation inline field
 # Go to the other board and create another issue

In the next video, I have 2 boards, "Copy for CT board" with component Test 1 and "CT board" with component Test 2, when I create an issue on "CT board" it takes the component from the previous board.
 [^create issue wrong component BUG.mp4] 

Note: This also applies to the other fields that work with the same feature like labels or versions.

h3. Expected Results
Each issue should have the component from the board in which it was created

h3. Actual Results
The second issue is taking the component from the previous board and not from the board where it is created

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When having components in the board filters, the quick created issues take the previous board component

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Turn-on the new issue view
# Go to a Kanban board
# Press the right-mouse button -> 'Delete'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a board without columns, the option from the board settings truncated, and if you not using English as your default language for Jira, there is not link from the board.

 # Create a board without columns
 # Access the board

The board shows the option to access the board settings.
h3. Actual Results
The left side truncated.

h3. Workaround

Change your Jira to English
Append *&config=columns* at the back of the board URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [View and understand the velocity chart|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/view-and-understand-the-velocity-chart/] states the following:

{quote}Commitment: The gray bar for each sprint shows the total estimate of all issues in the sprint when it begins. _After the sprint has started, any stories added to the sprint, or any changes made to estimates, *will not be included in this total*._ {quote}

But the Velocity Chart is considering the scope changes in the commitment column too

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSW classic project and add issues to it
# Add estimation (in story points) to the issues
# Create a new sprint and add some issues to the sprint. Start the sprint
# Complete some of the issues and add more issues with estimation to the sprint after it was started
# Complete the sprint
# Access the Velocity Chart

h3. Expected Results

The commitment bar shows only the estimation of the issues associated with the sprint when it was started 

h3. Actual Results

The commitment bar includes the scope changes too.

 !Screen Shot 2020-05-25 at 4.41.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-25 at 4.38.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Velocity Chart is considering scope changes as commitment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Service Desk next-gen issues are allowed to be dragged and dropped into sprints, but when the page is reloaded, the service desk issue is removed from the sprint. The change is even shown in the issue history and sends a notification. But the issue is then removed from the sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic scrum board;
# Add a Service Desk next-gen project to the filter and adjust the status columns;
# Drag and drop a service desk issue to a sprint;
# Refresh da page.

h3. Expected Results
There is a blocker saying that Service Desk next-gen issues can't be added to classic sprints.

h3. Actual Results
Jira allows the issue to be added to a sprint, send notifications and show in the issue history, but the issue is then removed from the sprint.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-22 at 14.50.33.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-05-22 at 14.52.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Classic boards allow users to add Service Desk next-gen issues into sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting issues from Jira to CSV, it would be helpful to be able to see the actual repo name of any linked repositories to that particular Jira issue has shown in the development panel via smart commits. Currently you can observe this data within Jira itself, but only when you click on the commits, branches, pull requests, etc links in the development panel. However when you export these issues, that development information is not stored in such a way that we can determine the name of the repository itself.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Jira Cloud with a repository, like in Bitbucket for example
 # Make a few commits that include the issuekey in the message
 # Confirm on the issue view in Jira that this development info is displayed and you can see the repo name
 # Now try to export that issue data in Jira to a CSV format via the issue navigator export feature

h3. Expected Results

It would be helpful if that export contained the same data that we can see in the dev panel itself
h3. Actual Results

While you can see some data in the "Development" field, this json payload does not explicitly reveal the name of the repo itself
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting Jira issues via CSV should also include linked development information such as repository name

fields.description:
When I open Jira task, I would like to have an opportunity to see all acceptance criteria on the full screen. Now I have to scroll it.

!image-2020-05-22-11-11-30-603.png!
fields.summary: Acceptance Criteria is too small

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the backlog view, clicking on the *+ Create Issue* button underneath Sprint/Backlog will allow users to create the issue inline.

Switching the project by clicking on the Project Name at the top left and creating the issue from backlog view will create the issue on the wrong project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Project A's board. Click on the *+ Create Issue* to create an issue inline from the backlog
 # Click on the Project Name on the top left and switch to another classic software project
 # Create the issue on another project's board using the same method as the 1st step - Click on the *+ Create Issue* and create the issue inline.
 # The issue is created but it's located on another board.
 #* Video:  [^Issue created on the wrong project.webm] 


h3. Expected Results
* The issue should be created on the project B's board.

h3. Actual Results
* The issue is created on the wrong project, hence it's not visible on the location where the user is creating it from.


h3. Workaround
* Don't switch project by clicking on the Project Name on the top left, as shown in the video. 
* Opening project B in a new tab will not cause this issue.
fields.summary: Issues created from board is created on the wrong project after switching project

fields.description:

 * The current documentation on Release burndown - [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/view-and-understand-the-release-burndown-report/] should also mention the scenario where it will say "All estimated issues are done"

fields.description:

We notice that the available options to customize colors for the horizontal navigation bar (_Settings > System > Look and Feel_) are the background and highlight colors.

_*For example:*_

!1.png|width=647,height=224!
 * If the background color is set to blue or red, then the text color in the horizontal navigation bar changes to white:

!2.png|width=647,height=224!

Even if we try setting the *Navigation colors* to default and modify the *Sidebar colors* only,  we notice that the *background* and *highlight* colors are changing but the behavior of the text color is as seen above.

!3.png|width=679,height=241!

Ability to customize the text color along with background and highlight colors on the new horizontal navigation bar [For Example:- White color text on Orange background]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When we try to add the "*Issue Resolved*" event to the Next-Gen project's notification feature (Simplified Notification Scheme) for any recipient (For example: "All watchers"), we face an error 500 Internal server error.
 * The issue is reported to have surfaced since the week of 11th May 2020.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a next-gen project and create an issue.
 2) Open notification helper:

_Jira settings > System > Notification helper [Shortcut key: "." ]_

3) Choose a user
 4) Choose the issue from Next-gen project
 5) Choose the notification event: "*Issue Resolved*"
 6) Click on submit
 * We see that the Issue resolved notification is not a part of the Next Gen Project's Simplified notification scheme.
 * In the details section, we see the following: "_No one currently receives notifications for the 'Issue Resolved' action. Add new recipient._"

7) Click on _Add new recipient_
 * We are redirected to a page to add a notification event to the Next-gen project's Simplified notification scheme.

8) Choose the event "*Issue Resolved*"
 9) Choose an audience to receive the notification. For example: "_All watchers_"
 10) Click on Add
 * We face -  Error 500 Internal server error

Note: The notification scheme of Next-gen Projects was updated recently. Kindly refer to the following announcement published on 11th May: [Announcement: Project Level Email notifications|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Announcement-Project-Level-Email-Notifications-for-next-gen/ba-p/1374538]. Unsure if this behavior could be due to this change.
h3. Expected Results

1. Either we successfully add the recipient to receive "_*Issue Resolved*_" notifications.

2. Or, since we do not see the option to choose the "*Issue Resolved*" notification event in the Notifications tab in NextGen Projects, we should probably prompt a message stating this action is not allowed.

!Screenshot 2020-05-18 at 11.12.06 AM.png|width=628,height=318!
h3. Actual Results
 * Error 500 - internal server error

!Screenshot 2020-05-18 at 11.17.17 AM.png|width=833,height=285!

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Something went wrong
Try reloading the page, then check our Statuspage for any current outages. If there are no relevant outages, create a support request so we can help you out.
If you create a request, include the following so we can help you as fast as possible:
* Error type: 500 - Internal server error
* Log reference: aa8d59df-c081-4df2-b462-e08454bb52d1{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding "Issue Resolved" event to the notification feature in Next-Gen Project leads to "Error 500 - Internal server error"

fields.description:
Currently, the release reports in Jira Software (Version Report and Release Burndown) display the information based on the stories assigned to the releases.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to have reports showing the release data based on Epics' progress.

Furthermore it would also make sense if you could automatically calculate the story points total of a task based on the sum of the subtask story point values.

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a configurer of an Agile board, similar to how I can configure my custom issue statuses to belong to one of the three options, I would also like to configure the columns on my agile board to be:
- {color:#205081}Not Started{color}
- {color:#f6c342}In Progress{color}
- {color:#8eb021}Done{color}

Currently the automatic assumption is that the very left column is {color:#205081}Not Started{color} and the very right column is {color:#8eb021}Done{color}.

This is a huge limitation in Jira Agile and causes problems especially with rendering the burndown chart.

I do not believe that asking the user to merge multiple of my columns into one or to create a separate Agile board is a sufficient solution for the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to add additional columns to also represent *Not Started* and *Done* in addition to the ability to already add an *In Progress* column.
 
h3. Note
Judging from the comments on GHS-10261 and GHS-11355 as well as [this post|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/218653/configuring-jira-agile-columns-for-notstarted-inprogress-and-done] on Atlassian Answers, I do feel that this is a feature of general interest.

Please stop closing every suggestion about this as "Answered" and leave any one of these three open for us to vote on.

Note: I am explicitly filing a duplicate of GHS-10261 and GHS-11355, both of which I find to have been closed prematurely.
fields.summary: In Configure Board, allow multiple "Not Started" (Blue) and "Done" (Green) columns

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master who is guiding my team through an essential SAFe agile transformation, it would be valuable to have a pre-designed template to support PI planning.

Acceptance Criteria:
 # The board must have the ability to integrate the Epics (not Jira epics), Features (associated to Jira Epics currently) and the associated users stories.
 # There should be various issue types in the template.
 # The Feature backlog should allow for Items to be scheduled in the feature backlog for "next PI" or Later.  
 # There should be a new place for new features to be placed when they are created by default.
 # There should be a visual to milestones, and the associated epic, features and stories can be linked to the associated to milestones.
 # The links between stories and features and/or epics must be visually obvious and be a graphically represented link to show the independent upstream/downstream.
 # There must be the ability to customize card types or inherit the associated details from the given project settings in Jira.
 # Ther emust be the ability to have swimlanes to represent various scrum teams.
 # There must be the ability to have 5 sprints within each PI event.
 # There must be a place for risks/issues to be managed, including a default place for new risk/issues to be added and the ability to follow the ROAN status (Resolved, Owned, Accepted, Mitigated.
 # Be able to leverage the existing user stories, features, epics and allow them to be managed during PI planning to help effectively plan your product increments.
 # Please read this page/video for reference:  [http://www.scaledagileframework.com/pi-planning/]

Please reach out with any questions.  Thank you.
fields.summary: PI Planning Board

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I would like to see all status columns (we have 7) without horizontal scrolling on the agile board.

 

This could be achieved by making the sidebar on the native Mac app collapsable, and/or adjusting the width of the status columns to fit the width of the window, or perhaps another solution I'm not considering.

 

I realize that 7 is maybe larger than average, but this singlehandedly prevents my adoption of the native app vs. the web experience.

 

Thanks for your consideration!
fields.summary: Mac app: collapsable sidebar

fields.description:
*The problem.*
We have 7 scrum teams working on the same product. Every scrum team has own sprint goal. We want to visualize all sprint goals in single view. Preferably in distraction-free form to be displayed on TV screen.


*Desired solution*
A dashboard gadget for visualizing current sprint goals. The best if it worked with active sprint and upcoming sprint.


*Acceptable solution*
A board or report for summing up all active sprint goals would probably also do the job.
fields.summary: Add Sprint goal dashboard gadget
